greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Product of numbers of 0's and 1's in binary representation of n.
comment: a(n) = 0 iff n=2^k-1 for some k.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1023
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: a(n) = a(floor(n/2)) + (1 - n mod 2) * A000120(floor(n/2)) + (n mod 2)*A023416(floor(n/2)).
example: a(14)=3 because 14 is 1110 in binary and has 3 ones and 1 zero.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{s = IntegerDigits[n, 2]}, Count[s, 0] Count[s, 1]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 0, 90}]
program: a071295 n = a000120 n * a023416 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 09 2014
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jun 20 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 11 2002
